titles.title: Carbon Hill National Fish Hatchery Conveyance Act
Carbon Hill National Fish Hatchery Conveyance Act
To direct the Secretary of the Interior to convey the Carbon Hill National Fish Hatchery to the State of Alabama.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Fisheries, Wildlife and Oceans.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee by Voice Vote.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 104-568.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 278.

action.text: Mr. Saxton moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minute of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.
Committee on Environment and Public Works. Committee consideration and Mark Up Session held.

committee.name: Committee on Environment and Public Works

calendar.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Environment and Public Works

action.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported to Senate by Senator Chafee without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 462.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 2/28/1996--Introduced. Carbon Hill National Fish Hatchery Conveyance Act - Mandates conveyance to the State of Alabama of the Carbon Hill National Fish Hatchery in Alabama for use by the Game and Fish Division of the Alabama Department of Conservation and Natural Resources as part of the fish culture program.
